abstract.para: The topic covers basic information regarding the supportconfig tool.

topic.para: If problems occur, you can use the supportconfig command-line tool to create a detailed system report. The tool collects information about the system, such as the current kernel version, hardware, installed packages, partition setup, and much more.

The command-line tool is provided by the package supportutils, which is installed by default. If the package is not installed , install with the zypper install supportutils command. However, supportconfig can integrate plug-ins that are used with each running of supportconfig. Which plug-ins are available on your system, depends on installed packages. The plug-ins are stored in the /usr/lib/supportconfig/plugins/ directory.
The supportconfig tool creates a TAR archive with detailed system information that you can hand over to Global Technical Support.
